summary:
☑ Who am I?

Accomplished protein biochemist with 5 years of experience in generating innovative ideas for new products and researching feasibility in terms of profitability, resource availability, and compliance. Insatiable curiosity and detail-oriented skills in protein expression, purification, and characterization utilizing cutting-edge biophysical/biochemical methodologies. Robust aptitude in applying all aspects of spectroscopic and calorimetric techniques. Highly skilled in investigating protein dynamics, protein-ligand interactions, and protein-protein interactions. Ability to juggle multiple priorities and achieve research results through alignment of multi-divisional activities in a highly collaborative, team-oriented environment. Skillful in leading the team towards the utilization of new instrumentation, lab experimentation, and R&D operational excellence. 

☑ My skills:

◉ Bacterial cell culture, mutagenesis, cloning. 
◉ Protein expression, purification, and characterization.
◉ Chromatography (affinity, ion exchange, size exclusion, HPLC, GC).
◉ AKTA FPLC, UNICORN Software.
◉ Spectroscopy (UV-Visible, fluorescence, CD).
◉ Gel electrophoresis.
◉ Calorimetry (ITC, DSC).
◉ Project management, problem-solving, team leadership, cross-functional collaboration, conflict resolution, strategic planning. 

☑ My achievements:

◉ Published 3 first-authored articles in peer-reviewed journals ACS Chemical Neuroscience and Metallomics.
◉ Presented research findings in 14 conferences, including ACS National Meetings and Biophysical Society Annual Meetings.
◉ Awarded the highly competitive dissertation year fellowship (DYF) from FIU.

☑ What am I looking for? 

Actively looking for research and development (R&D) scientist position in the pharmaceutical/biotech industry now. Willing to relocate anywhere in the USA. Do not need sponsorship.

Thanks for stopping by at my profile. 

I look forward to hearing from you. 

sazam002@fiu.edu | 7866162233

currentPositions.description:
Keywords: 

Downstream Process Development,  COVID-19 and Influenza Vaccine Development, Affinity, Ion-exchange, HIC, and SEC Chromatography, AKTA, UNICORN, ELISA, Western Blotting, UFDF, TFF.

☑ Developed and optimized affinity chromatography, ion-exchange chromatography (IEX), size exclusion chromatography (SEC), hydrophobic interaction chromatography (HIC), and tangential flow filtration (TFF) process parameters for the purification of SARS-CoV-2-rS Protein Drug Substance and Influenza hemagglutinin protein on AKTA platform using UNICORN software.

☑ Performed Solo-VPE, NanoDrop, SDS-PAGE, Western Blot, ELISA, BCA, and DLS experiments to support the downstream process development. 

☑ Got extensive training on Quality Risk Assessment (QRM), Statistical Method and Data Analysis (SMDA), Design of Experiments (DOE), and Robust Optimization and Tolerance Design (ROTD) utilizing JMP Software.
currentPositions.title: Research And Development Scientist

projects.description: Employing a combination of spectroscopic (absorption, fluorescence, circular dichroism) and calorimetric (ITC), we first time demonstrated binding of lead to DREAM. I did all experiments and wrote the manuscript which was edited by my mentor.
projects.title: Impact of lead binding to neuronal calcium sensor (NCS) protein downstream regulatory element antagonist modulator (DREAM).

projects.description: We first time demonstrated cadmium binding to DREAM protein utilizing both spectroscopic and calorimetric approach. I trained undergraduate student Gessica St. Louis who did cell culture and protein purification employing affinity chromatography and ion exchange chromatography under my supervision; I did rest experiments. I designed the whole project and wrote the manuscript, which was edited by my principal investigator.
projects.title: Consequences of Cadmium Binding to DREAM on its Secondary and Tertiary Structure and Interactions with Binding Partners.

projects.description: We demonstrated the binding of neuroprotective agent lithium to DREAM protein for the first time. I trained undergraduate students Sasha Rodriguez and Adriana Riveron who did the cell culture and assisted me in protein purification; I did the rest experiments. The computational study used in this project was done in collaboration with Dr. Prem Chapagain. He is a professor of the Department of Physics, Florida International University. I wrote the manuscript which was proofread by my mentor. The article has been submitted to the Journal of American Chemical Society (JACS).
projects.title: The Effect of Lithium Binding on Secondary and Tertiary Structure, Hydrophobicity, Thermodynamics, and Interactions with Interacting Partners of DREAM.

projects.description: In this project, we demonstrated that lysine to alanine mutation at position 87 of DREAM prevents DREAM interaction with presenilin and T-1 domain of potassium channel. I expressed, purified, and characterized the protein and did all experiments. I am writing a manuscript which we plan to submit in the peer-reviewed journal Biochemistry.
projects.title: Role of Lys Residue at Position 87 of DREAM in Allosteric Regulation of DREAM's Interactions with Potassium Channel.

projects.description: In this project, utilizing site-directed mutagenesis, I constructed the DREAM protein in which calcium-binding EF-hands were inactivated. We found that these mutations inhibit DREAM interactions with T-1 domain of potassium channels. This project was designed by my principal investigator. I expressed, purified, and characterized DREAM protein and did all experimental work.  I am writing a manuscript for this project which we aim to submit in the peer-reviewed journal The Protein Society.
projects.title: Consequences of EF-3 and EF-4 inactivation of DREAM on DREAM secondary and tertiary structures and DREAM interactions with binding partners.

projects.description: The poultry industry is one of the most rapidly growing agribusiness sectors in Bangladesh. Through poultry feed various fatty acid inter into poultry meat and through poultry meat it inter in the human body. In order to determine the composition of fatty acids, we collected ten different poultry feed samples from ten different poultry farm in Gazipur, an industrial area of Bangladesh. After that, we carried out extraction and analyzed the extract by using gas chromatography (GC) and high-performance liquid chromatography (HPLC). From the result, we found that lauric, palmitic, oleic, arachidic, behenic and lignoceric acid were found in the poultry feed samples in varying amount. Lignoceric acid is the component of mustard oil. Presence of lignoceric acid in poultry feed samples might be due to the use of mustard oil cake in the feed samples.
projects.title: Determination of Fatty Acid Compositions in Some Poultry Feed Samples

message.text: Great news for the Novavax. I am proud to be a supernova.

This collaboration combines Novavax’s R&D expertise and proprietary Matrix-M™ technology with Sanofi’s world-class leadership in launching and commercializing innovative vaccines.
Read the press release at: https://novav.ax/4dxQ3nu
